alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 14 at 3:05PM AKST until January 16 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MONDAY TO 6 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...From 6 AM Monday to 6 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
